name: Shrimp Pasta Skillet
author: Carolyn
summary: I used to make this skillet dinner with fresh Gulf shrimp just caught that morning in Louisiana, but it's still yummy with frozen shrimp here in Missouri. Pair it with crusty French bread and a glass of wine and you have good eatin'!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed
1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Saute tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, celery, garlic, and red pepper flakes in the hot oil for about 5 minutes
Add shrimp, bay leaf, thyme, oregano, pepper, and rosemary
Reduce heat and let simmer until shrimp are bright pink, about 15 minutes
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook bow-tie pasta at a boil, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes
Stir veggie and shrimp mixture into the drained pasta and serve
